mdRecord.dcterms:title: Moderne House, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Streamline Moderne architecture features buildings with sweeping curves. Even the windows are usually rounded, and porthole windows, most commonly found on ships, often make an appearance on these buildings. This style actually borrows many aspects from ships. They are often decorated with nautical themes, and one of the first buildings considered to be Streamline Moderne, the Normandie Hotel, in San Juan, Puerto Rico, was actually modeled after a ship, the SS Normandie. Moderne design often uses glass, cement, and chrome, instead of wood. Almost all the buildings have a horizontal orientation, and are much longer, or wider, than they are tall. They were usually painted with a light blue, beige, olive, pale yellow, or gray color scheme. http://architecture.answers.com/history/streamline-moderne-architecture-features-and-influences [work]
